content.subtitle: Westbrook had an undeniably special season and deserves it.

virtuals.subtitle: Westbrook had an undeniably special season and deserves it.

d20f6a9b8e0.title: The Thunder lost Kevin Durant and Serge Ibaka, yet STILL made the playoffs comfortably in the super…

paragraphs.name: d16f
paragraphs.text: The Thunder lost Kevin Durant and Serge Ibaka, yet STILL made the playoffs comfortably in the super competitive West. This fact is more impressive than any stat/efficiency rating/win share/time share/etc.

paragraphs.name: a796
paragraphs.text: Westbrook had an undeniably special season and deserves it.

paragraphs.name: cdde
paragraphs.text: MVP has to be Bestbrook. The man averaged a triple double, which nobody thought could ever be done again, AND led the league in scoring at over 30 a game. We might not see a season like this ever again. The only reason to give it to Harden at this point is because his team won 8 more games. However, when you consider the fact that Houston might have…

81e5767e76dd.title: I like that there’s not a case here for Kawhi.

paragraphs.text: I like that there’s not a case here for Kawhi. I’ve studied it long and hard and I genuinely don’t see one there. The numbers don’t measure up, the wins don’t measure up, and he doesn’t fit any historical MVP profile. I can buy him being on the ballot but I can’t find a case for putting him #1.

paragraphs.name: 851c
paragraphs.text: My take:

paragraphs.name: a0e3
paragraphs.text:
The MVP is James Harden
You know it in your heart to be truearcdigital.media

f272cafb496a.title: All these thresholds are arbitrary, acting like only triple doubles is an arbitrary number that…

paragraphs.name: d106
paragraphs.text: All these thresholds are arbitrary, acting like only triple doubles is an arbitrary number that doesnt mean a thing is a bit ridiculous. The only argument Harden has over anyone else is slightly better efficiency numbers, and he doesnt really even have that when you compare him to Lebron. Harden ranks poorly in other efficiency numbers (rebounding…

87dcf31a284.title: It’s a little disheartening that the ringer staff has so readily drunk the Simmons kool-aid on…

paragraphs.text: It’s a little disheartening that the ringer staff has so readily drunk the Simmons kool-aid on triple doubles being an arbitrary stat. Look up the all-time leaders in this category and you’ll see almost nothing but hall of famers or future hall of famers. Now look up true shooting percentage for this season (which apparently isn’t an arbitrary stat…

6f132ef6419b.title: With this MVP race I feel the media has turned greatness into a math problem and algorithm.

paragraphs.text: With this MVP race I feel the media has turned greatness into a math problem and algorithm. Which is a shame in that case people can easily manipulate and say this or that stat is arbitrary. Take away all the numbers for just a moment and just see with your eyes and heart as a human being, Russ has given the fans unforgettable moments in the season…

557c01dbcb21.title: Westbrook’s stats are about as good as Jimmy Butler’s.

paragraphs.text: Westbrook’s stats are about as good as Jimmy Butler’s. (13 to 14 WS, 17 to 17 WP, 17 to 17 RPM Wins).
The Thunder are a little better than the Bulls.

content.metaDescription: Russell Westbrook, James Harden, LeBron James, and Kawhi Leonard have headlined a memorable NBA season. But who is the MVP?

virtuals.subtitle: Our NBA writers take a close look at Westbrook, Harden, LeBron, and Kawhi
virtuals.metaDescription: Russell Westbrook, James Harden, LeBron James, and Kawhi Leonard have headlined a memorable NBA season. But who is the MVP?

paragraphs.name: e147
paragraphs.text: Who Is the NBA’s MVP?

paragraphs.name: 870e
paragraphs.text: Our NBA writers take a close look at Westbrook, Harden, LeBron, and Kawhi

cc31a8760257.title: Why isn’t the MVP a Warrior?

paragraphs.name: d371
paragraphs.text: Why isn’t the MVP a Warrior? Twelve teams have won 67 games in NBA history. Nine had the MVP and three had the runner-up. Who cares about 55 wins for the Rox or 51 for the Cavs? Those are middling playoff records just as much as OKC. If wins are your big criteria, Harden and LeBron are out along with Russ and a Warrior should win.

paragraphs.name: e618
paragraphs.text: What, no love for Rondo?

paragraphs.name: 40bf
paragraphs.text: Harden should be MVP. Don’t need my point guard grabbing 10 boards a game. Harden’s extra assist over Westbrook is much more valuable than Westbrook’s 2 boards over Harden.

content.subtitle: His performance head-to-head against all the other candidates are a revelation, and I think that we as a whole are overlooking how valuable…

virtuals.subtitle: His performance head-to-head against all the other candidates are a revelation, and I think that we as a whole are overlooking how valuable…

a45a17279926.title: A little bit disappointed no argument was made for Kawhi.

paragraphs.name: 3cd0
paragraphs.text: A little bit disappointed no argument was made for Kawhi. I get that his numbers don’t pop off the page like the presumed leaders of Harden and Westbrook, but some compelling stuff remains in his favor. He’s insanely efficient as the only all-star on the 2nd best team in the NBA while hardly losing any of his defensive potency. How many games can we…

paragraphs.name: 29e9
paragraphs.text: Curry.

content.subtitle: The only argument for Lebron is how absolutely incompetent Kyrie is at running at offense, and his admittedly crazy counting stats which…

virtuals.subtitle: The only argument for Lebron is how absolutely incompetent Kyrie is at running at offense, and his admittedly crazy counting stats which…

b6e8a25e7b61.title: Lebron is the best player in the league, there’s no doubt about that.

paragraphs.text: Lebron is the best player in the league, there’s no doubt about that. But he definitely does not deserve to win the MVP this year. He played 2 or 3 more minutes a game than all those guys, has two other all stars on his team, and for all that they have the 5th best record in the league. One more loss and they’re the 8th best record.

content.subtitle: I don’t understand how you can advocate or support a player who rests in the first half of the season and takes countless nights off with a…

virtuals.subtitle: I don’t understand how you can advocate or support a player who rests in the first half of the season and takes countless nights off with a…

paragraphs.name: 3a34
paragraphs.text: Russell is the MVP. He has the most convincing individual, team and entertainment/sentimental all-around season. Carried a broken and wrecked team, franchise and city. Played with the most heart and guts. The Analytics are there not just the triple double but BPM, VORP and PER. Brought the game to life all over the nation with passionate and loud…

848b27237488.title: I liked Bill’s theory that the middle-class of the league is so strong, that the top teams can’t…

paragraphs.text: I liked Bill’s theory that the middle-class of the league is so strong, that the top teams can’t really take a break. That being said, the MVP is LeBron James. That cavs team would’ve won 28 games this year without him. With him, they are going to make the Finals for a *third* straight year. He could have averaged a triple double if he really wanted…

paragraphs.text: “ and if humans counted in base 12 instead of base 10”
OK, now someone has to calculate how many triple doubles Big O would have had in ’62 if we counted in base 12, and how many Westbrook would have had this year.

content.subtitle: My MVP is Lebron because unlike the other players in this debate (aside from maybe Kawhi) he actually makes his teammates better rather…

virtuals.subtitle: My MVP is Lebron because unlike the other players in this debate (aside from maybe Kawhi) he actually makes his teammates better rather…

44ae6208bd3e.title: Why is Harden not only beating, but crushing the turnover record (with Westbrook close behind) not…

paragraphs.text: Why is Harden not only beating, but crushing the turnover record (with Westbrook close behind) not even mentioned? That has to count against them.

paragraphs.name: 7b7d
paragraphs.text: My MVP is Lebron because unlike the other players in this debate (aside from maybe Kawhi) he actually makes his teammates better rather than chases stats.

cfb88b965eb6.title: I don’t understand how the two leading MVP candidates can be playing each other in the first round…

paragraphs.name: eb04
paragraphs.text: I don’t understand how the two leading MVP candidates can be playing each other in the first round as 3 and 6 seeds. Of course, if triple doubles are arbitrary (although less so than Double-Doubles) then I’d wager then so are wins.
